item.title: Vide
item.description: Parfois je me sens vide. Vide comme un panier à champignons sans champignons. En fait, je sais pas vraiment comment c’est d’être vide comme un panier à champignons sans champignons. Mais je sais ce que c’est, ce vide qui me prend. Comme un vers qui n’a laissé derrière lui qu’une large cavité, là où il y avait mes émotions. Et soudain, plus rien. Le chaud, le froid m’indiffèrent. Le sucré me laisse de marbre.

item.title: Finally the end
item.description: Please do not read if you are in depression or in an unstable mental state. Try this one instead: a better read — You know, some other people are like me. I’ve met some. We share the same story. You’re down, feeling terrible, worthless, you feel there is no salvation to your pitiful soul and you think, you’re absolutely certain that you should’ve been thrown in a bottomless pit long ago.

item.title: Cette fille
item.description: J’ai cette fille dans ma tête. J’ai chaud, je transpire. Mon souffle ralenti et la brise fait osciller doucement ma tunique. L’air dans mes poumons est aussi chaud que celui que j’expire. J’écoute les instructions. Je lui prends les mains, doucement, de sorte que la position naturelle des doigts nous tiennent liés. J’entends le son des anges, le son des merveilles et des songes. La harpe m’a presque fait sursauter de joie.

item.title: Growth
item.description: Seed When we see a model in life, we generally tend to try, more or less consciously, to become more like it. Because we see something in this person that inspires us, or that feels so right, that we just want to take even just a piece of that for ourselves. Be it a value, a point of view, a character trait, many things can trigger this phenomenon. Is it his unbreakable determination?

item.title: Winter feeling
item.description: Introduction: It’s cold outside. Your nose is hardened by the cold and it starts running. Your fingertips are numb and your gloves don’t keep the warmth enough. Your breath creates wonderful volutes that your eyes, squinting through the wind, sometimes contemplate. And you find in your pockets, the cold metal that would deliver you. Your fingers have trouble holding it straight and turning it, but it clicks, it opens, and here you are.

item.title: Supernovae
item.description: Encore un débat, je sens déjà que ça pétille en moi. Ça gronde à chaque virgule, ça détonne à chaque point. Je navigue dans cette logique, ces prémisses délicates, ces hypothèses fertiles. Le flot de mes pensées vire gré des implications. Les écueils sauront s’occuper des sophismes jetés par dessus bord, et chaque biais mis à jour se verra mourir au soleil. Au dessus de moi, c’est un feu d’artifice qui jaillit à chaque inférence.

item.title: Celcius
item.description: Intro First of all there is one difficult word in there : hearth which designates the floor of the fireplace. To appreciate this poem, I recommend you to look in the vague (outdoors if possible) and do not fix anything at all, just blurry vision, for like 30 seconds. No, not right now, at the end of the intro. Take a deep breath. Now look away and then don’t be distracted by anything.

item.title: My Tiny Dragon
item.description: Text I have a dragon in my room. One may ask “Show me your dragon” but I cannot. Sadly, it is small, very very small. And it is fast, very very fast. One may ask “Then how do you know it exists ?” Well it’s simple. Sometimes I feel like I tripped over something but no cable, no furniture just a perfectly flat floor, as if it just carelessly bumped into me.
